H0.text: The pupil is the part of the eye that allows light to enter.

H1.text: Eyelid is the part of the eye that allows light to enter.

H2.text: Retina is the part of the eye that allows light to enter.

H3.text: The iris is the part of the eye that allows light to enter.

A4.text: Light enters the eye through the pupil, and the iris regulates the amount of light by controlling the size of the pupil.

A5.text: In bright light, the pupils constrict to prevent aberrations of light rays and thus attain their expected acuity; in the dark, this is not necessary, so it is chiefly concerned with admitting sufficient light into the eye.
